clinical_note.text: 70yo female presents with 2 days of dysuria, urgency, and suprapubic discomfort. PMH: Atrial Fibrillation (Afib), Hypertension. Current Medications: Warfarin 5mg daily. Exam: Afebrile, BP 132/78. Plan: Suspect cystitis, r/o UTI. Prescribing Bactrim DS (TMP/SMX) twice daily for 3 days.

diagnostic_hypothesis.reasoning: Prescribing Bactrim to a patient on Warfarin significantly potentiates the anticoagulant effect by inhibiting CYP2C9, leading to an elevated INR and increased risk of major hemorrhage.

failure_mode: Did not check INR while on Bactrim
ai_should_flag: Missing baseline or follow-up INR monitoring
Contraindicated medication choice given current anticoagulation regimen
